verses.verse: And there was a great<WH1419> cry<WH6818> of the people<WH5971> and of their wives<WH802> against their brothers<WH251> the Jews<WH3064>.

For there were<WH3426> that said<WH559>, We<WH1121>, our sons, and our daughters<WH1323>, are many<WH7227>: therefore we take up<WH3947> corn<WH1715> for them<WH398>, that we may eat, and live<WH2421>.

Some also there were<WH3426> that said<WH559>, We have mortgaged<WH6148> our lands<WH7704>, vineyards<WH3754>, and houses<WH1004>, that we might buy<WH3947> corn<WH1715>, because of the famine<WH7458>.
There were<WH3426> also that said<WH559>, We have borrowed<WH3867> money<WH3701> for the king<WH4428>'s tribute<WH4060>, and that upon our lands<WH7704> and vineyards<WH3754>.

Yet now our flesh<WH1320> is as the flesh<WH1320> of our brothers<WH251>, our sons<WH1121> as their sons<WH1121>: and<WH3533>, behold, we bring into bondage our sons<WH1121> and our daughters<WH1323> to be servants<WH5650>, and some of our daughters<WH1323> are<WH3426> brought unto bondage<WH3533> already<WH410>: neither is it in our power to redeem them<WH312>; for other men have our lands<WH7704> and vineyards<WH3754>.
And I was very<WH3966> angry<WH2734> when I heard<WH8085> their cry<WH2201> and these words<WH1697>.

Then I consulted<WH4427> with myself<WH3820>, and I rebuked<WH7378> the nobles<WH2715>, and the rulers<WH5461>, and said<WH559> unto them<WH5383>, You exact usury<WH4855>, every one<WH376> of his brother<WH251>. And I set<WH5414> a great<WH1419> assembly against them<WH6952>.

And I said<WH559> unto them<WH1767>, We after our ability have redeemed<WH7069> our brothers<WH251> the Jews<WH3064>, which were sold<WH4376> unto the heathen<WH1471>; and will you even sell<WH4376> your brothers<WH251>? or shall they be sold<WH4376> unto us<WH2790>? Then held they their peace, and found<WH4672> nothing to answer<WH1697>.

Also I said<WH559>, It is not good<WH2896> that<WH1697> you do<WH6213>: should you not walk<WH3212> in the fear<WH3374> of our God<WH430> because of the reproach<WH2781> of the heathen<WH1471> our enemies<WH341>?
I likewise<WH251>, and my brothers, and my servants<WH5288>, might lend<WH5383> them money<WH3701> and corn<WH1715>: I pray you<WH5800>, let us leave off this usury<WH4855>.

Restore<WH7725>, I pray you<WH3117>, to them, even this day, their lands<WH7704>, their vineyards<WH3754>, their oliveyards<WH2132>, and their houses<WH1004>, also the hundredth<WH3967> part of the money<WH3701>, and of the corn<WH1715>, the wine<WH8492>, and the oil<WH3323>, that you exact of them<WH5383>.

Then said<WH559> they<WH7725>, We will restore them<WH1245>, and will require nothing of them<WH6213>; so will we do as you say<WH559>. Then I called<WH7121> the priests<WH3548>, and took an oath<WH7650> of them<WH6213>, that they should do according to this promise<WH1697>.

Also I shook<WH5287> my lap<WH2684>, and said<WH559>, So God<WH430> shake out<WH5287> every man<WH376> from his house<WH1004>, and from his labor<WH3018>, that performs<WH6965> not this promise<WH1697>, even thus be he shaken out<WH5287>, and emptied<WH7386>. And all the congregation<WH6951> said<WH559>, Amen<WH543>, and praised<WH1984> the Lord<WH3068>. And the people<WH5971> did<WH6213> according to this promise<WH1697>.

Moreover from the time<WH3117> that I was appointed<WH6680> to be their governor<WH6346> in the land<WH776> of Judah<WH3063>, from the twentieth<WH6242> year<WH8141> even unto the two<WH8147> and thirtieth<WH7970> year<WH8141> of Artaxerxes<WH783> the king<WH4428>, that is<WH8147>, twelve years<WH8141>, I and my brothers<WH251> have not eaten<WH398> the bread<WH3899> of the governor<WH6346>.

But the former<WH7223> governors<WH6346> that had been before<WH6440> me were chargeable<WH3513> unto the people<WH5971>, and had taken<WH3947> of them bread<WH3899> and wine<WH3196>, beside<WH310> forty<WH705> shekels<WH8255> of silver<WH3701>; Yes<WH1571>, even their servants<WH5288> bore rule<WH7980> over the people<WH5971>: but so did<WH6213> not I<WH6440>, because of the fear<WH3374> of God<WH430>.
Yes<WH2388>, also I continued in the work<WH4399> of this wall<WH2346>, neither bought<WH7069> we any land<WH7704>: and all my servants<WH5288> were gathered<WH6908> there unto the work<WH4399>.

Moreover there were at my table<WH7979> a hundred<WH3967> and fifty<WH2572> of the Jews<WH3064> and rulers<WH5461>, beside those that came<WH935> unto us from among the heathen<WH1471> that are about us<WH5439>.

Now that which was prepared<WH6213> for me daily<WH3117> was one<WH259> ox<WH7794> and six<WH8337> choice<WH1305> sheep<WH6629>; also birds<WH6833> were prepared<WH6213> for me<WH6235>, and once in ten days<WH3117> store<WH7235> of all sorts of wine<WH3196>: yet for all<WH5973> this required<WH1245> not I the bread<WH3899> of the governor<WH6346>, because the bondage<WH5656> was heavy<WH3513> upon this people<WH5971>.
Think<WH2142> upon me<WH430>, my God, for good<WH2896>, according to all that I have done<WH6213> for this people<WH5971>.
